module.p:
taigh mór a big house –
Tha taigh mór air a’ chnoc.
There is a big house on the hill. td. 20
Càit a bheil an taigh mór? Tha an taigh mór air a’ chnoc àrd.
Where is the big house? The big house is on the tall hill. td. 21 [229]

taigh geal a white house –
Cha b’ann geal a bha an taigh.
The house was not white. td. 33

li.gd: Tha taigh mór air a’ chnoc.
li.tr: There is a big house on the hill.

li.gd: Càit a bheil an taigh mór? Tha an taigh mór air a’ chnoc àrd.
li.tr: Where is the big house? The big house is on the tall hill.

module.p:
cat ann an taigh a cat in a house –
A bheil an cat anns an taigh còmhla ri Seònaid?
Is the cat in the house with Janet? td. 15 [227]

cù aig taigh a dog at a house –
An do dh’fhàg Calum an cù aig an taigh? Dh’fhàg.
Did Malcolm leave the dog at the house? Yes, he did. td. 47

ruig taigh ... reaches a house –
Bha mi sgìth nuair a ràinig mi an taigh.
I was tired when I arrived home. td. 21
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. Bha càrn chlach air mullach na beinne. Chuir Calum clach air a’ chàrn agus shuidh e ri taobh a’ chùirn a’ leigeil analach. [...] An ceann greise dh’éirich Calum ’na sheasamh agus thearnaich e a’ bheinn air a shocair. Chòrd an latha gu math ris ach bha an t-acras mór air nuair a ràinig e an taigh.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. There was a cairn of stones on the top of the mountain. Calum put a stone onto the cairn and he sat down beside the cairn having a rest. [...] After a while Malcolm rose up and he descended the mountain leisurely. He enjoyed the day well but he was very hungry when he reached the house. td. 146

fàg taigh ... leaves a house –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Dh’ fhàg iad an taigh tràth anns a’ mhadainn.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] They left home early in the morning. td. 76
Bha an latha fuar agus cha do dh’fhàg sinn an taigh.
The day was cold and we didn’t leave the house. td. 238

cluich ann an taigh ... plays in a house –
Cha robh sinn a’ cluich anns an taigh.
We were not playing in the house. td. 21 [230]

fàg ... aig taigh ... leaves ... at a house –
An do dh’fhàg Calum an cù aig an taigh? Dh’fhàg.
Did Malcolm leave the dog at the house? Yes, he did. td. 47

fan ... aig taigh ... stays at a house –
An do dh’fhan Màiri aig an taigh an diugh? Cha do dh’fhan. Chaidh Màiri do’n sgoil anns a’ mhadainn
Did Mary stay at home today? No, she didn’t. She went to school in the morning. td. 237–8

li.gd: Dé tha ceàrr air a’ ghille seo? Tha a cheann goirt. An robh e anns an sgoil an diugh? Cha robh, bha e anns an taigh fad an latha.
li.tr: What is wrong with this boy? His head is sore. Was he in the school today? No, he was in the house all day long.

li.gd: Dé tha a’ chaileag a’ dèanamh anns an taigh?
li.tr: What is the girl doing in the house?

li.gd: Cha robh sinn a’ cluich anns an taigh.
li.tr: We were not playing in the house.
